briefTitle: Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ON101 Cream for the Treatment of Chronic Diabetic Foot Ulcers

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Complete Ulcer Closure
outcomeMeasures.description:
The primary variable is the number of target ulcers healed in each group within 16 weeks. The primary efficacy outcome is the comparison of the incidence of complete healing of the target ulcer between the two treatment groups at the end of treatment.

For the purpose of this study a complete healing will be defined as complete epithelialization which is maintained with no drainage for at least 2 weeks and is confirmed by a blinded assessor.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Time of Healing Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Time to complete ulcer healing, The time of the original healing will be taken as the time to healing.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Ulcer Area
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage change in ulcer surface area from baseline

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With a 50% Reduction of Ulcer Surface Area
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of subjects with a 50% reduction of ulcer surface area

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Infection of the Target Ulcer
outcomeMeasures.description: Incidence of infection of the target ulcer
